summary: Hi! What are you thoughts on Evanstan?:P  I feel like it was a huge thing at one point but they almost never put Chris & Seb...
question: Hi! What are you thoughts on Evanstan?:P  I feel like it was a huge thing at one point but they almost never put Chris & Seb together for press and with Stackie and EvansDowney, Evanstan was basically non-existent.  Like it such a fandom phenomenon to me because while they’ve said nice things about each other, they barely interact?  Sometimes it did feel like Seb was in awe of Chris a little and while Chris likes him, if any of the OG6 are together, they always tend to pair off with each other.
answer:
Hi there, Nonnie,

Honestly, I think Evanstan was more of a bi-product of people imprinting their Stucky feels on the actors more than anything else. Not to say that Chris and Seb don’t genuinely enjoy each other’s company or that they don’t consider the other a friend, but I think fandom wanted the two of them to have that mythical bond that Steve and Bucky so clearly have, and Chris and Seb just aren’t those people.

(I also never got the impression that Seb was in awe of Chris - admired him, yes, but in awe, no.)

Otoh, Chris has that bond with RDJ and Seb has that bond with Mackie, which is why we kept seeing those pairings during press junkets. :)

Otoh, Chris has that bond with RDJ and Seb has that bond with Mackie, which is why we kept seeing those pairings during press junkets. :)

blog.name: chrisevansimaginez
blog.title: Chris Evans
blog.description: I write Marvel Imagines, mostly of Chris Evans and sometimes other things.

summary: It’s been a long, long time
title: It’s been a long, long time
body:
Chapter 2:

Steve Rogers x Reader

Warning: None, I guess being sad kind of???? 

A/n:  So anyways my note is basically towards the ending, I forgot to mention in the last chapter that this is inspired by the first avenger. so I added him waking up years later but changed the ending? kind of? I guess. Idk anyways hope you all like it, sorry for my ugly rusty writing, I’m trying to get my muse back for writing.  ( yeah these chapters are kind of short)


Shots had been fired all around him as he held y/n in his arms, everything for him seemed to be moving fast, so he moved faster or attempted to. “I got you y/n,” He said as he ran to put her out of sight. He had run deep into the woods and leaned her against a tree. “We’re gonna fix this, you’re going to be okay.” She reached up for Steve’s face and he took it cradling it against his cheek. “You have to go, go save the others while you still can.” She said smiling weakly. Steve hesitated for a moment, “Go.” she said as she held her hand tightly against her wound. Steve nodded, “I’m going to come back I promise you.” he said as he ran to go help the other soldiers. As he arrived at the base he snuck around looking for anyone he saw that was familiar, he laid eyes on bucky and went towards him. “Bucky!” he said. Bucky turned to look and let out a sigh of relief. “I thought I had lost you, pal,” he said placing his hand on his shoulder and giving him a light squeeze. As they both came up with a plan they had gone their separate ways and promised to meet each other where Steve had left y/n. 

After Steve had fought off the bad guys, and they were no longer at the base he had run back to where he had left y/n, and when he got there she was lying there, her body lifeless. He kneeled on his knees and scooped her up into his arms carrying her back. As Steve had arrived at the base he could see y/n’s father through the smoke and he carried her to him. Her father stood there looking at her lifeless body and took her from Steve. Steve furrowed his eyebrows and frowned. “I…I’m so sorry sir,” he said as he bowed his head down. Her father looked at Steve in anger. “You were supposed to protect us all, what use are you if you can’t even protect my daughter?”  He said taking his daughter away and into one of the cars. Steve could see him embracing his daughter’s body into his arms tightly as tears were rolling down his face. Steve let out a deep sigh and he felt a hand on his shoulder. “I’m sorry Steve,” Bucky said as he patted him on the shoulder and they both just watched as y/n’s father disappeared into the darkness of the woods. taking his daughter with him. 

A week later, It was the funeral of y/n, Steve had fixed his tie and looked at himself in the mirror of his apartment. “Steve?” Bucky said as he walked into his room, “I barely knew her, yet I feel responsible for her.” He said staring at bucky through the mirror. “You had no idea that was going to happen, and besides she would want you to go.” Steve clenched his jaw and nodded. When they both arrived Steve had stopped Bucky, “I would rather stay right here, I don’t want to bother them.” Bucky nodded and stood next to Steve as they watched. Steve placed his hands in his pockets and looked down at the ground, even though he barely knew y/n he felt some kind of connection with her, she was funny to him, her smile, her lips everything about her intrigued him, but now that she was gone a part of him was gone too. As the funeral ended all of the people left little by little until it was only Steve and Bucky left. Bucky said nothing but stood there with Steve. “You can go if you want, I think I’m going to hang out here for a bit.” He said. “I’m not leaving you, pal.” He said smiling at him. Steve had walked to where she had been buried and stood there for a moment. “I’m sorry I let this happen to you.” he paused for a moment and the rain had started to pour, he didn’t move a muscle, he just stayed. 

*********************************************************

Present time. 

Several months later after the war, Steve had sacrificed himself in order to save others. He had crash landed a plane into the frozen ice and remained there for 75 years, everyone had thought he had been dead. He woke up in a brightly lit room, nothing but the sound of the radio. He got out of bed and looked around him. A woman had come inside of the room, “Hello Mr. Rogers, you’re up..good.” she said. Steve had been confused, he furrowed his eyebrows and listened carefully to the sound of the radio, he knew things weren’t right, he began to ask the woman questions. And mentioned that the game playing on the radio was of a baseball game that he once went to with his dad. The woman swallowed hard and paged some of the agents that had been watching him. Steve saw and quickly crashed through the walls of the small room taking him somewhere else. As he ran through the streets of New York, everything had been different to him, where the hell was he? He stopped to look around him and saw a bunch of black cars surrounding him, and a man with an eyepatch walked out along with a woman, “Hey Captian America!” said the man, Steve turned around and as he did he laid eyes upon the woman, His grew wide, she resembled the woman he had lost so long ago.

Present time. 

Several months later after the war, Steve had sacrificed himself in order to save others. He had crash landed a plane into the frozen ice and remained there for 75 years, everyone had thought he had been dead. He woke up in a brightly lit room, nothing but the sound of the radio. He got out of bed and looked around him. A woman had come inside of the room, “Hello Mr. Rogers, you’re up..good.” she said. Steve had been confused, he furrowed his eyebrows and listened carefully to the sound of the radio, he knew things weren’t right, he began to ask the woman questions. And mentioned that the game playing on the radio was of a baseball game that he once went to with his dad. The woman swallowed hard and paged some of the agents that had been watching him. Steve saw and quickly crashed through the walls of the small room taking him somewhere else. As he ran through the streets of New York, everything had been different to him, where the hell was he? He stopped to look around him and saw a bunch of black cars surrounding him, and a man with an eyepatch walked out along with a woman, “Hey Captian America!” said the man, Steve turned around and as he did he laid eyes upon the woman, His grew wide, she resembled the woman he had lost so long ago.
